Package users

Interface IStudent

All Superinterfaces:
IUser
All Known Implementing Classes:
Student
public interface IStudent
extends IUser
Interface defining the contract for student-specific functionality. This interface extends the base functionality provided by IUser with methods specific to student management, such as gender and student type. Classes implementing this interface must provide both the student-specific functionality defined here and the base user functionality from IUser.
See Also:
IUser, Student, StudentType

    • setGender

      Sets the student's gender.
      Parameters:

    • getType

      java.lang.String getType()
      Gets the student's type (e.g., full-time, part-time, international, or DA).
      Returns:
      The type of the student
      See Also:
      for valid student types: FULL_TIME ("Full time"), PART_TIME ("Part time"), INTERNATIONAL ("International"), DA ("DA")

    • setType

      void setType​(java.lang.String type)
      Sets the student's type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type to set for the student. Should be one of the valid types as defined in StudentType enum
      See Also:
      for valid student types

    • toString

      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the student including all base user information plus student-specific attributes.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface IUser
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string containing all student information in the format: "[base user info], Gender: [gender], Type: [type]"

    • getByCourse

      static java.util.List<Student> getByCourse​(java.lang.String courseName) throws java.io.IOException
      Retrieves a list of students filtered by course name. Loads student data from a JSON file and filters based on the provided course name. If no course name is provided, returns all students.
      Parameters:
      courseName - The name of the course to filter by, or empty/null for all students
      Returns:
      A list of students enrolled in the specified course, or all students if no course specified
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there is an error reading or processing the student data file
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If there is an error processing the JSON file
